body_html:
I don't really understand your (input_size of h, output_size of h).
I glanced over two papers you mentioned above, but didn't find anything related to input size and output size. Did I miss something?

Could you please explain it by pointing out the shapes of all matrices in LSTM update formulae?
Say, if input_size of h is m and output_size of h is n, what's the shape of W^{gh} and other matrices?
body_text:
I don't really understand your (input_size of h, output_size of h).
I glanced over two papers you mentioned above, but didn't find anything related to input size and output size. Did I miss something?
Could you please explain it by pointing out the shapes of all matrices in LSTM update formulae?
Say, if input_size of h is m and output_size of h is n, what's the shape of W^{gh} and other matrices?
body:
I don't really understand your (input_size of h, output_size of h). 
I glanced over two papers you mentioned above, but didn't find anything related to input size and output size. Did I miss something?

Could you please explain it by pointing out the shapes of all matrices in LSTM update formulae?
Say, if input_size of `h` is `m` and output_size of `h` is `n`, what's the shape of W^{gh} and other matrices?
